if-two-functions-f-and-h-squeeze-togethe.text: If two functions (f and h) squeeze together at a particular point (a), then any function trapped between them will get squeezed to that same point.

if-fxleq-gxleq-hx-when-x-is-near-a-excep.text: If $f(x)\leq g(x)\leq h(x)$ when $x$ is near $a$ (except possibly at $a$) and $lim{x\to a}f(x) = lim{x\to a}h(x) = L$, then $lim_{x\to a}g(x) = L$.

suppose-there-are-three-functions-such-t.text: Suppose there are three functions such that $f(x)\leq g(x)\leq h(x)$ when x is near 1. Given that $f(x) = 2x^3-x^2+5$ and $h(x) = 4-2(cos \pi x)$, find $lim_{x\to 1}g(x)$.

important-trig-limits-based-on-this-theo.text: Important trig limits based on this theorem:

lim_xto-0frac1---cos-xx--0-this-one-is-s.text: $lim_{x\to 0}\frac{1 - cos x}{x} = 0$ (This one is signifcantly less used)

in-problems-you-will-have-to-simplify-co.text: In problems, you will have to simplify coefficients to get to these trig limits. Once you do it right, you'll know because it all cancels out to a $const$.
